status_reasons.description: CloudWatch alarms do not exist in the account

securityhub_findings.description: The version of openssl found on instance i-abcd1234 is known to contain a vulnerability.

note.text: Don't forget to check under the mat.

recommendation.text: Run sudo yum update and cross your fingers and toes.

rule.description: The version of openssl found on instance i-abcd1234 is known to contain a vulnerability.
rule.name: EC2.20 Both VPN tunnels for an AWS Site-to-Site VPN connection should be up

securityhub_findings.description: This control checks whether your Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance metadata version is configured with Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2). The control passes if HttpTokens is set to required for IMDSv2. The control fails if HttpTokens is set to optional.

types: Software and Configuration Checks/Industry and Regulatory Standards/AWS-Foundational-Security-Best-Practices

recommendation.text: For directions on how to fix this issue, consult the AWS Security Hub Foundational Security Best Practices documentation.

securityhub_findings.title: EC2.8 EC2 instances should use Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2)
types: Software and Configuration Checks/Industry and Regulatory Standards/AWS-Foundational-Security-Best-Practices

rule.description: This control checks whether your Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance metadata version is configured with Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2). The control passes if HttpTokens is set to required for IMDSv2. The control fails if HttpTokens is set to optional.
rule.name: EC2.8 EC2 instances should use Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2)

status_reasons.description: This finding has a compliance status of NOT AVAILABLE because AWS Config sent Security Hub a finding with a compliance state of Not Applicable. The potential reasons for a Not Applicable finding from Config are that (1) a resource has been moved out of scope of the Config rule; (2) the Config rule has been deleted; (3) the resource has been deleted; or (4) the logic of the Config rule itself includes scenarios where Not Applicable is returned. The specific reason why Not Applicable is returned is not available in the Config rule evaluation.

rule.description: This control checks whether your Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance metadata version is configured with Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2). The control passes if HttpTokens is set to required for IMDSv2. The control fails if HttpTokens is set to optional.
rule.name: EC2 instances should use Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2)

securityhub_findings.description: This control checks whether an Amazon S3 general purpose bucket is encrypted with an AWS KMS key (SSE-KMS or DSSE-KMS). The control fails if the bucket is encrypted with default encryption (SSE-S3).

fields.aws/securityhub/annotation: Amazon S3 bucket is not encrypted with AWS KMS key.

types: Software and Configuration Checks/Industry and Regulatory Standards

recommendation.text: For information on how to correct this issue, consult the AWS Security Hub controls documentation.

securityhub_findings.description: This control checks whether an Amazon EC2 security group allows ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 to remote server administration ports (ports 22 and 3389). The control fails if the security group allows ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 to port 22 or 3389.

types: Software and Configuration Checks/Industry and Regulatory Standards

recommendation.text: For information on how to correct this issue, consult the AWS Security Hub controls documentation.

securityhub_findings.title: EC2 security groups should not allow ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 to remote server administration ports
types: Software and Configuration Checks/Industry and Regulatory Standards

rule.description: This control checks whether an Amazon EC2 security group allows ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 to remote server administration ports (ports 22 and 3389). The control fails if the security group allows ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 to port 22 or 3389.
rule.name: EC2 security groups should not allow ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 to remote server administration ports
